sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Draw.Dot procedure is used to color the dot (pixel) at location (x, y) using the specified Color.
sections.text_content: The Draw.Dot procedure is used to color the dot (pixel) at location (x, y) using the specified Color.
sections.mdown_content:
The **Draw.Dot** procedure is used to color the dot (pixel) at location (_x_, _y_) using the specified _Color_.



![Doc Image](draw_dot01.gif)

sections.title: Example
code:
View.Set ("graphics")
        var x, y, c : int
        loop
            x := Rand.Int (0, maxx)     % Random x
            y := Rand.Int (0, maxy)     % Random y
            c := Rand.Int (0, maxcolor) % Random color
            Draw.Dot (x, y, c)
        end loop
sections.raw_content: This program randomly draws dots with random colors. The maxx, maxy and maxcolor functions give the maximum x, y and color values.
sections.text_content: This program randomly draws dots with random colors. The maxx, maxy and maxcolor functions give the maximum x, y and color values.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The screen must be in a "graphics" mode. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, an error will occur. See View.Set for details.

sections.mdown_content: The screen must be in a "_graphics_" mode. If the screen is not in a "_graphics_" mode, an error will occur. See **View.Set** for details.
